title: Riot's balance team
body:
You are about to witness what happens in the riot balance team

"O Mai faking gad, eve has a 20% pick ban rate with a 30% win rate in the LC$? That's too much, even TDK kez insta locked her instead of gragss, this can't be happening let's nerf her to unviability!"

Meanwhile kalista has a 95% pick ban rate with a ~60% win rate in LC$

Gragas has a 97% pick bane rate and a ~55% win rate.

How the f**k does the balance team come with these nerfs? They nerfed kalista's auto attacks instead of her unlimited stacking rend that slows.

Rito pls.

while i agree, that they didnt nerf kallista where it counts, eve is always a problem when shes viable.

because riot refuses to touch her with anything but nerfs to her ratios and base kit. when the only thign they really need to do is give us a way to ward halfway decently with green wards against her, as they made pink wards useless for that purpose.

for a short time, they had a mandrake ward on the pbe, that would issue a ping on itself, when eve enters its vision area. if they would add that function to regular green wards, then they could buff eves base kit again.

we dont even need to pinpoint her location or have her stealth broken. just some way to know that shes around, so we can stop turret hugging for a second, when a ward pings on another part of the map.
You can always ward deeper in her jungle, red, blue and raptors.

doesnt help 

she clears and dissapears ... you wont know whether she goes to you or the other lane nearby
Unless she stays in a monster camp for 5 seconds I don't see how that's the case.

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZXltyTG,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-07-15T19:56:10.261+0000)
>
> You can always ward deeper in her jungle, red, blue and raptors.

that is in many situations far too dangerous. at least on top lane you have to go deep into the enemy jungle and ward at least 2 spots at red, and the golems.

you take the risk of randomly running into her and getting boxed in by her and the enemy laners. the next problem is, that it takes valuable time away from the lane in which your opponent farms or pushes creeps into your turret.

even if you do, as has been stated. she does the camp and then disappears. you dont know in which direction she went. could be a couple of minutes before she pops up somewhere else on the map and you know youre safe. or she might just suddenly pop up in your face.

the windows at which you can ward the enemy jungle safely are too rare, and you wont find them very early on in the game, where her ganks hurt the most.

and that still doesnt guarantee, that she just  doesnt come walking up the river and ganks you without going through her jungle and doing camps first, or she may just walk through the lane.

against any other jungler you can usually ward the river entrance to your lane, and the lane bushes if you want to be sure not to get ganked. you will also see the enemy jungler pop up on wards of your team on other spots of the map, which can be important information.

if the enemy jungler is around bot lane, you can make an aggressive play on your opponent without being worried about getting baited into a gank. in case of eve, you always have to assume that shes around and the best strategy is to basically play passive the entire time.

really all we have to do is some ability to ward properly against her.

I'm actually a fan of the direction Riot took w/ Kalista's nerf.  It seems like they're acknowledging the give and take of maintaining a power budget, so that if you create a carry with strengths in utility and mobility, then they probably need to have low damage.  Hitting skill damage is cute, but how much does skill damage matter lategame for most ADCs?  The fact that Kalista is still using her skill lategame already puts her above most ADCs.  On top of that, most of the ADC skills that actually do get used lategame are used for utility/repositioning rather than damage, but Kalista already gets the repositioning with her autos anyway.

As for Eve, it's probably because stealth has always been hard to balance.  It's a mechanic that tends to be far stronger in solo queue than in coordinated play, so it's bound to be off-balanced in one or the other.  The other thing I could guess is concern over runeglaive on Eve, but Riot's gutting runeglaive too so that would seem a poor reason.
